title: Columns
text: file contains locality-specific physician fee schedule payment amounts services covered Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (MPFS) one record unique combination carrier, locality, procedure code modifier. mac Carrier Number Medicare Administrative Contractor (MAC) Number locality Locality Identification Pricing Locality hcpcs HCPCS Code CPT Level 2 HCPCS code number service mod Modifier diagnostic tests, blank field denotes global service Modifiers 26 & TC identify components. Modifier 53 indicates separate RVUs fee schedule amount established procedures physician terminated completion. status Status Code Indicates whether code fee schedule whether separately payable service covered. RVUs associated status codes , R, T, used Medicare payment. mult_surg Multiple Surgery Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule multiple procedures (Modifier 51) flat_vis Flat Rate Visit Fee Effective January 1, 2021, field may also contain Flat Visit Fee Primary Care First Model nther Non-Facility Therapy Reduction Pricing amount reflects 50 percent payment PE services furnished office noninstitutional settings fther Facility Therapy Reduction Pricing amount reflects 50 percent payment PE services furnished institutional setting fee_nf Non-Facility Fee Schedule Amount Pricing amount non-facility setting. fee_f Facility Fee Schedule Amount Pricing amount facility setting. opps OPPS Indicator 1 = Subject OPPS payment cap determination, 9 = subject OPPS payment cap determination opps_nf OPPS Non-Facility Pricing amount non-facility setting capped level OPPS Payment Amount opps_f OPPS Facility Pricing amount facility setting capped level OPPS Payment Amount
code: northstar:::col_lab("md", "pfs") |>    gt_style()

title: Columns
text: file contains information services covered Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (MPFS) 2024. 10,000 physician services, file contains associated relative value units (RVUs), fee schedule status indicator, various payment policy indicators needed payment adjustment (.e., payment assistant surgery, team surgery, bilateral surgery, etc.). Medicare physician fee schedule amounts adjusted reflect variation practice costs area area. geographic practice cost index (GPCI) established every Medicare payment locality three components procedure’s relative value unit (.e., RVUs work, practice expense, malpractice). GPCIs applied calculation fee schedule payment amount multiplying RVU component times GPCI component. hcpcs HCPCS Code CPT Level 2 HCPCS code number service description Description Description service mod Modifier diagnostic tests, blank field denotes global service Modifiers 26 & TC identify components. Modifier 53 indicates separate RVUs fee schedule amount established procedures physician terminated completion. status Status Code Indicates whether code fee schedule whether separately payable service covered. RVUs associated status codes , R, T, used Medicare payment. wrvu Work RVU Relative Value Unit (RVU) physician work service nprvu Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU Relative Value Unit (RVU) resource-based practice expense non-facility setting fprvu Facility Practice Expense RVU Relative Value Unit (RVU) resource-based practice expense facility setting mrvu Malpractice RVU Relative Value Unit (RVU) malpractice expense service cf Conversion Factor multiplier transforms relative values payment amounts. conversion factor reflects MEI update adjustment. 2002 beyond, single conversion factor services. nprvu_opps Non-Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Non-Facility Practice Expense RVUs used OPPS payment amount fprvu_opps Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Facility Practice Expense RVUs used OPPS payment amount global Global Days Identifies number global days service op_ind Operative Percentage Indicator 1 = percentages, 0 = percentages op_pre Preoperative Percentage Percentage preoperative portion global package op_intra Intraoperative Percentage Percentage intraoperative portion global package, including postoperative work hospital op_post Postoperative Percentage Percentage postoperative portion global package provided office discharge hospital pctc PCTC Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule service mult_proc Multiple Procedure Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule multiple procedures (Modifier 51) surg_bilat Bilateral Surgery Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule bilateral procedures (Modifier 50) surg_asst Assistant Surgery Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule assistant surgery (Modifier 80, 81, 82, ) surg_co Co-Surgery Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule co-surgeons (Modifier 62) surg_team Team Surgery Indicator Indicates applicable payment adjustment rule team surgeons (Modifier 66) endo Endoscopic Base Code Identifies endoscopic base code code multiple surgery indicator 3 supvis Physician Supervision Indicator Indicates level physician supervision required service dximg Diagnostic Imaging Family Indicator Identifies applicable diagnostic service family HCPCS codes multiple procedure indicator 4 unused Used Medicare Payment Indicates whether code used Medicare payment rare Rarely/Never Performed Indicates procedure rarely/never performed : 00 (Neither), 01 (Facility), 10 (Non-Facility), 11 ()
code: northstar:::col_lab("md", "rvu") |>    gt_style()

title: Columns
code: foot_53 <- "Not used to report the elective cancellation of a procedure prior to the patient's anesthesia induction and/or surgical preparation in the operating suite. For outpatient hospital/ambulatory surgery center (ASC) reporting of a previously scheduled procedure/service that is partially reduced or cancelled as a result of extenuating circumstances or those that threaten the well being of the patient prior to or after administration of anesthesia, see modifiers 73 and 74 (see modifiers approved for ASC hospital outpatient use)."  foot_mod <- "For services other than those with a professional and/or technical component, a blank will appear in this field with one exception: the presence of CPT modifier 53 indicates that separate RVUs and a fee schedule amount have been established for procedures which the physician terminated before completion. This modifier is used only with colonoscopy CPT codes 44388 and 45378, or with G0105 and G0121. Any other codes billed with modifier 53 are subject to carrier medical review and priced by individual consideration."  modifiers <- dplyr::tibble(   mod = c("26", "TC", "53"),   name = c("Professional Component", "Technical Component", "Discontinued Procedure"),   description = c(     "Certain procedures are a combination of a physician or other qualified health care professional component and a technical component. When the physician or other qualified health care professional component is reported separately, the service may be identified by adding modifier 26 to the usual procedure number.",     "Under certain circumstances, a charge may be made for the technical component alone. Under those circumstances the technical component charge is identified by adding modifier TC to the usual procedure number. Technical component charges are institutional charges and not billed separately by physicians; however, portable x-ray suppliers only bill for technical component and should utilize modifier TC. The charge data from portable x-ray suppliers will then be used to build customary and prevailing profiles.",     "Under certain circumstances, the physician or other qualified health care professional may elect to terminate a surgical or diagnostic procedure. Due to extenuating circumstances or those that threaten the well being of the patient, it may be necessary to indicate that a surgical or diagnostic procedure was started but discontinued. This circumstance may be reported by adding modifier 53 to the code reported by the individual for the discontinued procedure."   ) )    modifiers |>    gt(rowname_col = "mod") |>    cols_align(align = "left") |>    opt_all_caps() |>   tab_style(     style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(16)),     locations = cells_stub()   ) |>    tab_header(title = "For diagnostic tests, a blank in this field denotes the Global Service & the following modifiers identify the components:") |>    tab_footnote(     footnote = foot_53,     locations = cells_stub(rows = 3)   ) |>    tab_footnote(     footnote = foot_mod   ) |>    tab_options(     table.font.size = px(14),     table.width = pct(100),     heading.title.font.size = px(16),     heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16),     heading.align = "left",     source_notes.font.size = px(16),     row_group.as_column = TRUE     )

title: Columns
text: Indicates whether code fee schedule whether separately payable service covered. See Attachment description values. RVUs associated status codes , R, T, used Medicare payment.
code: dplyr::tibble(code = sort(   c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F", "I", "M", "R", "N", "J", "P", "T", "X"))) |>    dplyr::mutate(ref = purrr::map(code, status_codes)) |>    tidyr::unnest_wider(col = ref) |>    gt(rowname_col = "code") |>    cols_align(align = "left") |>    fmt_markdown() |>    fmt_integer() |>    opt_all_caps() |>   tab_style(     style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(16)),     locations = cells_stub()   ) |>    tab_style(     style = cell_fill(color = "yellow", alpha = 0.3),     locations = cells_body(       columns = everything(),       rows = c(1, 12, 13))) |>    tab_options(     table.font.size = px(14),     table.width = pct(100),     heading.title.font.size = px(16),     heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16),     heading.align = "left",     source_notes.font.size = px(16),     row_group.as_column = TRUE,     row_group.font.size = px(24)     ) #> Error in `dplyr::mutate()`: #> ℹ In argument: `ref = purrr::map(code, status_codes)`. #> Caused by error: #> ! object 'status_codes' not found

title: Columns
text: 000 Endoscopic minor procedure related preoperative postoperative relative values day procedure included fee schedule payment amountEvaluation Management services day procedure generally payable. 010 Minor procedure preoperative relative values day procedure postoperative relative values 10-day postoperative period included fee schedule amountEvaluation Management services day procedure 10-day postoperative period generally payable. 090 Major surgery 1-day preoperative period 90-day postoperative period included fee schedule amount. MMM Maternity codes; usual global period apply. XXX Global concept apply. YYY Carrier determines whether global concept applies establishes postoperative period, appropriate, time pricing. ZZZ Code related another service always included global period service.
code:
glob_join <- dplyr::tibble( global = c("000", "010", "090", "MMM", "XXX", "YYY", "ZZZ"), description = c( "Endoscopic or minor procedure with related preoperative and postoperative relative values on the day of the procedure only included in the fee schedule payment amount

Evaluation and Management services on the day of the procedure generally not payable.", "Minor procedure with preoperative relative values on the day of the procedure and postoperative relative values during a 10-day postoperative period included in the fee schedule amount

Evaluation and Management services on the day of the procedure and during the 10-day postoperative period generally not payable.", "Major surgery with a 1-day preoperative period and 90-day postoperative period included in the fee schedule amount.", "Maternity codes; usual global period does not apply.", "Global concept does not apply.", "Carrier determines whether the global concept applies and establishes postoperative period, if appropriate, at time of pricing.", "Code is related to another service and is always included in the global period of the other service." ) ) glob_join |> gt(rowname_col = "global") |> fmt_markdown() |> fmt_integer() |> cols_align(align = "left") |> opt_all_caps() |> tab_style( style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(16)), locations = cells_stub() ) |> tab_options( table.font.size = px(14), table.width = pct(100), heading.title.font.size = px(16), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16), heading.align = "left", source_notes.font.size = px(16), row_group.as_column = TRUE )

title: Columns
text: Physician Services Modifiers 26 TC used since Physician Services split Professional Technical components.Examples: Visits, Consultations, Surgical Procedures.RVU Components: PW, PE, MP. Diagnostic Tests Radiology Services Modifiers 26 TC can used codes.Examples: Pulmonary Function Tests, Therapeutic Radiology Procedures, e.g., Radiation Therapy.codes Professional Technical component.Total RVUs codes reported 26 modifier include values physician work, practice expense, malpractice expense.Total RVUs codes reported TC modifier include values practice expense malpractice expense .Total RVUs codes reported without modifier include values physician work, practice expense, malpractice expense. Professional Component Modifiers 26 TC used codes.Stand-alone codes describe physician work portion selected diagnostic tests associated code describes technical component diagnostic test another associated code describes global test.Example Code: 93010: Electrocardiogram; Interpretation Report.RVU Components: PW, PE, MP. Technical Component Modifiers 26 TC used codes.Stand-alone codes describe technical component (.e., staff equipment costs) selected diagnostic tests associated code describes professional component diagnostic test . Also identifies codes covered diagnostic tests therefore related professional code.Example Code: 93005 Electrocardiogram; Tracing , without interpretation report.RVU Components: PE MP . Global Test Modifiers 26 TC used codes.Stand-alone codes describe selected diagnostic tests associated codes describe () professional component test , (b) technical component test .RVU Components: PW, PE, MP.Total RVUs = Sum total RVUs professional technical components codes combined. Incident Modifiers 26 TC used codes.Services covered incident physician’s service provided auxiliary personnel employed physician working direct personal supervision.Payment may made carriers services provided hospital inpatients patients hospital outpatient department. Laboratory Physician Interpretation Modifier TC used codes.Clinical laboratory codes separate payment interpretations laboratory physicians may made. Actual performance tests paid lab fee schedule. RVU Components: PW, PE, MP. Physical Therapy Service Payment may made service provided either patient hospital outpatient department inpatient hospital independently practicing physical occupational therapist. Physician Interpretation Identifies professional component clinical laboratory codes separate payment may made physician interprets abnormal smear hospital inpatient. applies CPT codes 88141, 85060 HCPCS code P3001-26. TC billing recognized payment underlying clinical laboratory test made hospital, generally PPS rate. payment recognized CPT codes 88141, 85060 HCPCS code P3001-26 furnished hospital outpatients non-hospital patients. physician interpretation paid clinical laboratory fee schedule payment clinical laboratory test. Applicable Concept professional/technical component apply.
code:
pctc_codes <- dplyr::tibble(code = 0:9) pctc_label <- c( "0" = "Physician Services", "1" = "Diagnostic Tests for Radiology Services", "2" = "Professional Component Only", "3" = "Technical Component Only", "4" = "Global Test Only", "5" = "Incident To", "6" = "Laboratory Physician Interpretation", "7" = "Physical Therapy Service", "8" = "Physician Interpretation", "9" = "Not Applicable" ) pctc_desc <- c( "0" = "Modifiers 26 and TC cannot be used since Physician Services cannot be split into Professional and Technical components.

Examples: Visits, Consultations, Surgical Procedures.

RVU Components: **PW**, **PE**, **MP**.", "1" = "Modifiers 26 and TC can be used with these codes.

Examples: Pulmonary Function Tests, Therapeutic Radiology Procedures, e.g., Radiation Therapy.

These codes have both a Professional and Technical component.

Total RVUs for codes reported with a 26 modifier include values for physician work, practice expense, and malpractice expense.

Total RVUs for codes reported with a TC modifier include values for practice expense and malpractice expense only.

Total RVUs for codes reported without a modifier include values for physician work, practice expense, and malpractice expense.", "2" = "Modifiers 26 and TC cannot be used with these codes.

Stand-alone codes that describe the physician work portion of selected diagnostic tests for which there is an associated code that describes the technical component of the diagnostic test only and another associated code that describes the global test.

Example Code: **93010**: *Electrocardiogram; Interpretation and Report.*

RVU Components: **PW**, **PE**, **MP**.", "3" = "Modifiers 26 and TC cannot be used with these codes.

Stand-alone codes that describe the technical component (i.e., staff and equipment costs) of selected diagnostic tests for which there is an associated code that describes the professional component of the diagnostic test only. Also identifies codes that are covered only as diagnostic tests and therefore do not have a related professional code.

Example Code: **93005** *Electrocardiogram; Tracing Only, without interpretation and report*.

RVU Components: **PE** and **MP** only.", "4" = "Modifiers 26 and TC cannot be used with these codes.

Stand-alone codes that describe selected diagnostic tests for which there are associated codes that describe *(a)* the professional component of the test only, and *(b)* the technical component of the test only.

RVU Components: **PW**, **PE**, **MP**.

Total RVUs = Sum of the total RVUs for the professional and technical components only codes combined.", "5" = "Modifiers 26 and TC cannot be used with these codes.

Services covered incident to a physician's service when they are provided by auxiliary personnel employed by the physician and working under his or her direct personal supervision.

Payment may not be made by carriers for these services when they are provided to hospital inpatients or patients in a hospital outpatient department.", "6" = "Modifier TC cannot be used with these codes.

Clinical laboratory codes for which separate payment for interpretations by laboratory physicians may be made. Actual performance of the tests is paid for under the lab fee schedule.

RVU Components: **PW**, **PE**, **MP**.", "7" = "Payment may not be made if the service is provided to either a patient in a hospital outpatient department or to an inpatient of the hospital by an independently practicing physical or occupational therapist.", "8" = "Identifies the professional component of clinical laboratory codes for which separate payment may be made only if the physician interprets an abnormal smear for hospital inpatient. This applies to CPT codes 88141, 85060 and HCPCS code P3001-26. No TC billing is recognized because payment for the underlying clinical laboratory test is made to the hospital, generally through the PPS rate. No payment is recognized for CPT codes 88141, 85060 or HCPCS code P3001-26 furnished to hospital outpatients or non-hospital patients. The physician interpretation is paid through the clinical laboratory fee schedule payment for the clinical laboratory test.", "9" = "Concept of a professional/technical component does not apply." ) pctc_codes |> dplyr::mutate( category = pctc_label[as.character(code)], description = pctc_desc[as.character(code)] ) |> gt(rowname_col = "code") |> tab_style( style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(16)), locations = cells_stub() ) |> cols_align(align = "left") |> fmt_markdown() |> fmt_integer() |> opt_all_caps() |> opt_row_striping() |> tab_options( table_body.vlines.style = "solid", table_body.vlines.width = px(2), table.font.size = px(14), table.width = pct(100), heading.title.font.size = px(16), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16), heading.align = "left", source_notes.font.size = px(16), row_group.as_column = TRUE )

title: Columns
text: 0 payment adjustment rules.procedure reported day another procedure, base payment lower () actual charge, (b) fee schedule amount procedure. 2 Standard payment adjustment rules.procedure reported day another procedure indicator 1, 2 3, rank procedures fee schedule amount apply appropriate reduction code (100%, 50%, 50%, 50%, 50% report).Base payment lower () actual charge, (b) fee schedule amount reduced appropriate percentage. 3 Special rules Multiple Endoscopic Procedures apply procedure billed another endoscopy family (.e., another endoscopy base procedure).base procedure code indicator identified Endobase field.Apply multiple endoscopy rules family ranking family procedures performed day.Example: Multiple endoscopies family reported day endoscopies another family day non-endoscopic procedure.endoscopic procedure reported base procedure, pay separately base procedure. Payment base procedure included payment endoscopy. 4 Special rules technical component (TC) diagnostic imaging procedures apply procedure billed another diagnostic imaging procedure family (per diagnostic imaging family indicator).procedure reported session day another procedure family indicator, rank procedures fee schedule amount TC. Pay 100% highest priced procedure, 50% subsequent procedure. Base payment subsequent procedures lower () actual charge, (b) fee schedule amount reduced appropriate percentage.Subject 50% reduction TC diagnostic imaging. Subject 5% reduction PC diagnostic imaging. 5 Subject 50% practice expense component certain therapy services. 6 Subject 25% reduction second highest subsequent procedures TC diagnostic cardiovascular services. 7 Subject 20% reduction second highest subsequent procedures TC diagnostic ophthalmology services. 9 Missing
code:
mult_pro_lookup <- c( "0" = "No payment adjustment rules.

If the procedure is reported on the same day as another procedure, base the payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount for the procedure.", "1" = "Standard payment adjustment rules.

If the procedure is reported on the same day as another procedure that has an indicator of 1, 2 or 3, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount and apply the appropriate reduction to this code (100%, 50%, 25%, 25%, 25%, and by report).

Base the payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage.", "2" = "Standard payment adjustment rules.

If the procedure is reported on the same day as another procedure with an indicator of 1, 2 or 3, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount and apply the appropriate reduction to this code (100%, 50%, 50%, 50%, 50% and by report).

Base the payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage.", "3" = "Special rules for Multiple Endoscopic Procedures apply if procedure is billed with another endoscopy in the same family (i.e., another endoscopy that has the same base procedure).

The base procedure for each code with this indicator is identified in the Endobase field.

Apply the multiple endoscopy rules to a family before ranking the family with the other procedures performed on the same day.

Example: Multiple endoscopies in the same family are reported on the same day as endoscopies in another family or on the same day as a non-endoscopic procedure.

If an endoscopic procedure is reported with only its base procedure, do not pay separately for the base procedure. Payment for the base procedure is included in the payment for the other endoscopy.", "4" = "Special rules for the technical component (TC) of diagnostic imaging procedures apply if procedure is billed with another diagnostic imaging procedure in the same family (per the diagnostic imaging family indicator).

If the procedure is reported in the same session on the same day as another procedure with the same family indicator, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount for the TC. Pay 100% for the highest priced procedure, and 50% for each subsequent procedure. Base the payment for subsequent procedures on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage.

Subject to 50% reduction of the TC diagnostic imaging. Subject to 5% reduction of the PC of diagnostic imaging.", "5" = "Subject to 50% of the practice expense component for certain therapy services.", "6" = "Subject to 25% reduction of the second highest and subsequent procedures to the TC of diagnostic cardiovascular services.", "7" = "Subject to 20% reduction of the second highest and subsequent procedures to the TC of diagnostic ophthalmology services.", "9" = "Missing" ) rvu() |> count(mult_proc) |> filter(!is.na(mult_proc)) |> mutate(description = mult_pro_lookup[mult_proc]) |> gt(rowname_col = "mult_proc") |> fmt_markdown() |> fmt_integer() |> tab_style( style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(18)), locations = cells_stub() ) |> cols_align(align = "left") |> cols_label(n = "# of Codes") |> opt_all_caps() |> tab_options( table.font.size = px(14), table.width = pct(100), heading.title.font.size = px(16), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16), heading.align = "left", source_notes.font.size = px(16), row_group.as_column = TRUE )

what: Geographic Practice Cost Indices by State & Medicare Locality
title: Columns
text: file contains Geographic Practice Cost Index (GPCI) component carrier/locality 2024 well locality/county crosswalk. GPCI reflects relative costs physician work, practice expense, malpractice insurance geographic area compared national average costs component.
code: gpci() |> select(-counties) |> gt(rowname_col = "mac", groupname_col = "state") |> tab_stubhead(label = "State | MAC") |> cols_label( mac = "MAC", state = "State", locality = "Locality", name = "Name", wgpci = "Work", pgpci = "Practice", mgpci = "Malpractice", two_macs = "Two MACs") |> cols_merge( columns = c(locality, name), pattern = "{1}<< {2}>>") |> cols_align(align = "left") |> opt_all_caps() |> fmt_number( decimals = 3, drop_trailing_zeros = TRUE) |> tab_footnote( footnote = "MAC assignments as of November 22, 2023", locations = cells_stubhead()) |> tab_footnote( footnote = md("Work GPCI reflects a 1.5 floor in Alaska established by [**MIPPA**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medicare_Improvements_for_Patients_and_Providers_Act_of_2008)."), cells_body(columns = locality, rows = 1)) |> tab_footnote( footnote = "PE GPCI reflects a 1.0 floor for Frontier States established by the ACA.", cells_body( columns = locality, rows = c(68, 70, 81, 91, 109))) |> tab_footnote( footnote = md("**Note**: The *Further Continuing Appropriations and Other Extensions Act, 2024* (Section 501) extended the 1.0 Work GPCI floor through January 19, 2024. Therefore, the Work GPCIs for 2023 reflect the 1.0 Work GPCI floor. Work GPCIs for 2024 are shown both with and without a 1.0 floor and Work GPCIs for 2025 do not reflect a 1.0 floor.")) |> tab_style( style = cell_text(align = "center", size = px(14)), locations = cells_stub()) |> tab_options( table.font.size = px(14), table.width = pct(100), heading.title.font.size = px(16), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(16), heading.align = "left", source_notes.font.size = px(16), row_group.as_column = TRUE) |> gt_marks(cols = c(two_macs))

title: Fee Schedule
code: hcpcs_search(   hcpcs = c("39503", "43116", "33935", "11646", "1164F", "V5299"),    state = "GA",    locality = "99",    mac = "10212") #> # A tibble: 5 × 80 #>   hcpcs description      long_description short_description cons_desc clin_descs #>   <chr> <chr>            <chr>            <chr>             <chr>     <list>     #> 1 V5299 Hearing service  Hearing service… Hearing service   NA        <NULL>     #> 2 11646 Exc f/e/e/n/l m… NA               NA                Removal … <tibble>   #> 3 33935 Transplantation… NA               NA                Transpla… <tibble>   #> 4 39503 Repair of diaph… NA               NA                Repair o… <tibble>   #> 5 43116 Partial removal… NA               NA                Partial … <tibble>   #> # ℹ 74 more variables: mod <chr>, status <chr>, mac <chr>, state <chr>, #> #   locality <chr>, area <chr>, counties <chr>, two_macs <lgl>, wgpci <dbl>, #> #   pgpci <dbl>, mgpci <dbl>, wrvu <dbl>, nonfac_prvu <dbl>, fac_prvu <dbl>, #> #   mrvu <dbl>, cf <dbl>, fac_par <dbl>, nonfac_par <dbl>, fac_nonpar <dbl>, #> #   nonfac_nonpar <dbl>, fac_limit <dbl>, nonfac_limit <dbl>, opps <chr>, #> #   nonfac_prvu_opps <dbl>, fac_prvu_opps <dbl>, mrvu_opps <dbl>, #> #   mult_surg <chr>, flat_vis <dbl>, nonfac_therapy <dbl>, fac_therapy <dbl>, …

title: Fee Schedule
text: Participating amount calculated follows:  \[x = [(RVU_w \times GPCI_w) + (RVU_p \times GPCI_p) + (RVU_m \times GPCI_m)] \times CF\]  Non-participating amount calculated follows:  \[ y = 0.95x\]  Limiting charge calculated follows:  \[ z = 0.95(1.15x)\]
code: calculate_amounts(wrvu  = 6.26,              nprvu = 7.92,              fprvu = 4.36,              mrvu  = 0.99,              cf    = 32.744,              wgpci = 1,              pgpci = 0.883,              mgpci = 1.125) #> Facility: #> Participating Amount    = $367.51 #> Non-Particpating Amount = $349.13 #> Limiting Charge         = $401.50 #>  #> Non-Facility: #> Participating Amount    = $470.44 #> Non-Particpating Amount = $446.91 #> Limiting Charge         = $513.95

what: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
text: ((wRVU x wGPCI) + (pRVU x pGPCI) + (mRVU x mGPCI)) x Conversion Factor

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
code: calculate_amounts(wrvu, fprvu, nprvu, mrvu, wgpci, pgpci, mgpci, cf = 32.7442)

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
text: wrvu < double > Work RVU fprvu < double > Facility Practice Expense RVU nprvu < double > Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU mrvu < double > Malpractice RVU wgpci < double > Work GPCI pgpci < double > Practice Expense GPCI mgpci < double > Malpractice GPCI cf < double > Conversion Factor, default 32.7442

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
text: Facility & Non-Facility Participating, Non-Participating & Limiting Charge Amounts

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
code: calculate_amounts(wrvu  = 6.26,                   nprvu = 7.92,                   fprvu = 4.36,                   mrvu  = 0.99,                   wgpci = 1.053,                   pgpci = 0.883,                   mgpci = 1.125,                   cf    = 32.7442) #> Facility: #> Participating Amount    = $378.37 #> Non-Particpating Amount = $359.45 #> Limiting Charge         = $413.37 #>  #> Non-Facility: #> Participating Amount    = $481.30 #> Non-Particpating Amount = $457.24 #> Limiting Charge         = $525.82

title: 2024 Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) — level2
Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
text: Medicare limiting charge set law 115% payment amount service furnished Non-participating physician.

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
code: limiting_charge(par_amount)

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
text: par_amount < double > Participating Amount

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
text: numeric vector Limiting Charge Amount

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
text: However, law sets payment amount Non-participating physicians 95% payment amount Participating physicians (.e., fee schedule amount). Calculating 95% 115% amount equivalent multiplying amount factor 1.0925 (109.25%). Therefore, calculate Medicare limiting charge physician service locality, multiply fee schedule amount factor 1.0925. result Medicare limiting charge service locality fee schedule amount applies.

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
code: limiting_charge(26.35) #> [1] 28.78738

title: Calculate Non-Participating Amount — nonpar_amount
text: payment amount Non-participating physicians 95% payment amount Participating physicians (.e., fee schedule amount).

what: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: rbcs() allows user group HCPCS codes clinically meaningful categories based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification.

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
code: rbcs(   hcpcs = NULL,   rbcs = NULL,   category = NULL,   subcategory = NULL,   family = NULL,   major = NULL )

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: hcpcs < character > HCPCS CPT code rbcs < character > RBCS ID category < character > RBCS Category Description, e.g. Anesthesia DME E&M Imaging Procedure Test Treatment subcategory < character > RBCS Subcategory Description family < character > RBCS Family Description major < character > Whether HCPCS code "Major", "", "Non-Procedure" code.

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: tibble columns:

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System (RBCS) taxonomy allows researchers group Medicare Part B healthcare service codes clinically meaningful categories subcategories. Based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification created 1980s, includes notable updates Part B non-physician services undergoes annual updates technical expert panel researchers clinicians. general framework grouping service codes new RBCS taxonomy largely follows structure BETOS. Like BETOS, RBCS groups HCPCS codes categories, subcategories, families – categories aggregate level families granular level. Medicare Part B service codes, including non-physician services, assigned 6-character RBCS taxonomy code.

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System RBCS Data Dictionary

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: Annually

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
